newsitem.title: HUNGARY: Germany to take back hazardous waste from Hungary.
newsitem.headline: Germany to take back hazardous waste from Hungary.

text.p: Germany will take back a shipment of 380 tonnes of hazardous waste stuck in Hungary for months after Croatia refused to grant transit, the Hungarian environment ministry said on Monday.
"We can confirm that Germany will take back the shipment," ministry spokesman Jozsef Nagy told Reuters.
Hungary had asked Germany to take back the industrial chemicals which Budapest authorities regarded as an illegal consignment of hazardous waste.
Press reports said the shipment included six tonnes of wood preservative from the north German state of Lower Saxony and 34 tonnes of a substance used to treat the outer shell of army tanks.
The consignment was due to be shipped to China via Croatia, but Croatian authorities refused to let it cross the border.
